newsitem.title: SLOVENIA: Slovenian shares ease, seen stagnating.
newsitem.headline: Slovenian shares ease, seen stagnating.

text.p: Slovenian shares fell 0.37 percent on Wednesday and traders said the market was likely to remain locked in its current narrow range for the week.

"I do not expect any major changes on the market before fresh foreign money enters the market, but that is a political question, which I doubt will be solved before the end of the year," Andrej Obed, a trader at "A" bank, said.
* The seven share SBI index dropped 3.57 points to 968.94.
* 11 shares fell and three rose, while nine were untraded.
* Total turnover fell to 62.5 million tolars from 105.3 million.
* Drug trading company Salus was the most actively traded, falling 0.06 percent to 14,616 tolars on volume of 2,030 shares for total turnover of 29.7 million tolars.
* Construction company GPG was the leading decliner, falling 9.27 percent to 9,140 tolars on volume of 101 shares for total turnover of 923,000 tolars.
* Brokerage Nika was the biggest gainer, firming 2.05 percent to 3,852 tolars on volume of 530 shares for total turnover of two million tolars.
